conclusion: Average velocity is calculated using total displacement over time interval.
Total displacement is the area under the curve in a velocity-time graph.
The graph shows two curves for Car A and Car B starting at v2 at t=0 and ending at v1 at t=t1.
To compare average velocities, compare areas under the curves for Car A and Car B.
The second diagram overlays straight lines connecting (0, v2) to (t1, v1) for both cars.
If curves lie above straight lines, area under curves is greater than area under straight lines.
If curves lie below straight lines, area under curves is less than area under straight lines.
For Car A, the curve lies above the straight line connecting (0, v2) and (t1, v1).
For Car B, the curve lies below the straight line connecting (0, v2) and (t1, v1).
Area under curve for Car A is greater than area under straight line; for Car B, it is less.
Average velocity of Car A is greater than average velocity of Car B.
